Bias in LLMs for Robotics

run_prompts module

Module containing methods to run prompts on a model.

run_prompts.run_for_scores(prompt_set, filename: str, model_name: str = 'tiiuae/falcon-7b', top_n: int = 10)[source]

Run prompts through a model, where the top_n most likely next tokens and their probabilities are generated for each prompt, then written to a csv file.

Parameters:

  • prompt_set – Dataset of prompts to run through the model.

  • filename – Name of the file to write the scores to.

  • model_name – Name of model to use, must be able to load with AutoModelForCausalLM. Defaults to Falcon-7B.

  • top_n – The number of words to get the highest probabilities for. Defaults to 10.

run_prompts.run_for_seqs(input_set, output_filename: str, model_name: str = 'tiiuae/falcon-7b', **kwargs)[source]

Run prompts through a model, where sequences are generated for each prompt and written to a file.

Parameters:

  • input_set – Dataset of prompts to run through the model.

  • model_name – Name of model to use, must be able to load with AutoModelForCausalLM. Defaults to Falcon-7B.

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments to pass to the pipeline function.

Returns:

Output sequences from running the prompts through the model.

run_prompts.test_for_scores(prompt: str, model_name: str = 'tiiuae/falcon-7b', top_n: int = 10)[source]

Run a single prompt through a model and print the top_n most likely next tokens and their probabilities.

Parameters:

  • prompt – Prompt to run through the model.

  • model_name – Name of model to use, must be able to load with AutoModelForCausalLM. Defaults to Falcon-7B.

  • top_n – The number of words to get the highest probabilities for. Defaults to 10.

run_prompts.test_for_seqs(prompt: str, model_name: str = 'tiiuae/falcon-7b', **kwargs)[source]

Run a single prompt on a model and print the output sequences.

Parameters:

  • prompt – Prompt to run through the model.

  • model_name – Name of model to use, must be able to load with AutoModelForCausalLM. Defaults to Falcon-7B.

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments to pass to the pipeline function.
